intro: Randia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved randia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia lancifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
